client_profile: Family with 1 child in Brussels looking to buy a home. Budget between 630000 and 1130000 EUR. Priorities include family-friendly environment, nightlife, and access to parks.
must_have: Good schools within a 20 min walk
Access to parks and green spaces
red_flags: High noise levels near major roads
Long commute times in specific areas
contradictions: Desire for quiet residential but nightlife access
Parks needed, but must remain budget-friendly
Family-friendly areas may sacrifice nightlife options
next_steps: Shortlist 8–12 listings across the 3 communes and set up viewings.
Confirm total purchase cost: price + notary/registration fees + recurring charges.
Validate commute: run one test route at peak hours (public transport and by car if relevant).
Ask about parking (permit vs private spot), storage, and building rules.
Prepare a document pack for offers: ID, proof of funds/pre-approval, and key questions for the seller.
Request EPC, urbanism/permit docs, and recent syndic/HOA minutes before committing.
Do an evening walk-through for your top 2 choices to assess noise and street feel.
Plan your notary steps and financing timeline; align deed date with your move plan.
Book a second visit with measurements/photos to compare objectively.
If needed, line up a survey/technical inspection for building issues.
viewing_checklist: Noise: check windows closed/open, street vs courtyard orientation.
Heating & insulation: type, EPC score, drafts, humidity/mold signs.
Charges: what's included (common areas, heating, water) and past statements.
Building works: planned renovations, roof/façade, lift, syndic notes.
Internet/cell coverage: quick speed test on site.
Storage: cellar, bike room, stroller access, elevator size.
Parking: permit eligibility, private spot, guest parking, EV charging.
Safety basics: entrance, lighting, intercom, visibility at night.
Documents: EPC, urbanism/permit info, recent syndic/HOA minutes.
Total budget: mortgage + recurring charges + utilities + insurance + taxes.
offer_strategy: Move quickly on strong listings: good units can disappear within days.
Clarify conditions (financing, sale of current property) early; keep them realistic.
Ask for EPC, urbanism info, and syndic documents before committing (buying).
Confirm timelines: offer validity, deed date (buying) or move-in date (renting).
Negotiate on total package: included furniture, repairs, parking spot, charges.

first_72h: Set up a local SIM / data plan and enable 2FA for banking.
Confirm temporary address and keep copies of the lease / purchase agreement.
Book commune appointment for registration (as soon as address is confirmed).
first_2_weeks: Register at the commune (address registration); follow up on police check if required.
Choose a GP (médecin généraliste) and register with a mutualité (health fund).
Arrange energy + internet contracts if not included (electricity/gas/internet).
If you have a child: shortlist daycare/schools and start the application process.
first_2_months: Set up a Belgian bank account if needed and update payroll details.
Review insurance (home contents, liability); confirm coverage start date.
If driving: confirm parking permit process, resident rules, and any LEZ requirements.

registration_checklist: Proof of address: signed lease / deed / housing attestation.
Civil status docs if relevant (marriage/birth certificates) — bring originals and copies.
Work proof: contract or employer letter (useful for some registrations).
Keep digital scans of all documents and a folder for commune appointments.
Confirm appointment booking channel (commune website/IRISbox when applicable) and required forms.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Pierre

model.overall: Overall = round( (Safety + Family + Commute + Lifestyle + BudgetFit) / 5 )

why: Family-oriented location near Parc de Woluwe park for outdoor activities.
Excellent access to shops and cafes within walking distance.
watch_out: Prices can be above average; verify recent sales data.
strengths: Stronger green pockets around Saint - Paul (parks and calmer streets).
Family-oriented pockets around Saint - Paul with parks/schools within reach.
Often preferred by families due to parks/schools access and calmer pockets.
tradeoffs: Prime pockets can be pricey; validate the full purchase cost (price + fees + recurring charges).

priority_snapshot.housing_cost: Higher cost; budget may feel tight in prime streets.
priority_snapshot.transit: metro access, tram coverage, near train links
priority_snapshot.commute_access: depends on address; check travel times
priority_snapshot.schools_family: generally family-friendly; parks/schools are a key advantage

top_districts.budget_reality: Rule of thumb for a €630,000–€1,130,000 purchase in this commune: target 2–3BR (sometimes 4BR) depending on condition/building type. Budget fit here is generally workable with more options; verify listing density and condition during viewings.

microhoods.name: Saint-Paul
microhoods.highlights: Good starting point with good tram coverage, solid schools/childcare density. Watch for street-to-street variation-validate exact address.

microhoods.name: Chant D’oiseau
microhoods.highlights: Good starting point with more green space and park access, solid schools/childcare density. Watch for transit access varies street-to-street.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Lambert

model.overall: Overall = round( (Safety + Family + Commute + Lifestyle + BudgetFit) / 5 )

why: Strong fit for your priorities around Kapelleveld.
Balanced trade-off between lifestyle and commute.
watch_out: Popular family areas book fast; prices can be above average.
strengths: Calmer, more residential pockets around Kapelleveld compared with busier hubs.
Family-oriented pockets around Kapelleveld with parks/schools within reach.
Reliable public transport coverage for everyday commuting.
Above-average connectivity for commuting across Brussels.
tradeoffs: Check building charges (syndic), EPC, and noise insulation — these vary street-by-street.

priority_snapshot.housing_cost: Higher cost; budget may feel tight in prime streets.
priority_snapshot.commute_access: depends on address; check travel times
priority_snapshot.schools_family: generally family-friendly; parks/schools are a key advantage

top_districts.budget_reality: Rule of thumb for a €630,000–€1,130,000 purchase in this commune: target 2–3BR (sometimes 4BR) depending on condition/building type. Budget fit here is workable with trade-offs with moderate competition; verify listing density and condition during viewings.

microhoods.name: Kapelleveld
microhoods.highlights: Good starting point with more green space and park access, strong metro connectivity, solid schools/childcare density, good café and brunch scene. Watch for busier evenings in lively pockets.

microhoods.name: Val D’or
microhoods.highlights: Good starting point with more green space and park access, solid schools/childcare density. Watch for street-to-street variation-validate exact address.

top_districts.name: Uccle

model.overall: Overall = round( (Safety + Family + Commute + Lifestyle + BudgetFit) / 5 )

why: Strong fit for your priorities around Foret de Soignes.
Balanced trade-off between lifestyle and commute.
watch_out: Commute can be slower without a car; some pockets stretch budgets.
strengths: Calmer, more residential pockets around Vivier D’oie compared with busier hubs.
Family-oriented pockets around Vivier D’oie with parks/schools within reach.
Generally calmer residential feel compared with central nightlife hubs.
tradeoffs: Commute convenience varies; test your door-to-door route at peak hours before committing.

priority_snapshot.housing_cost: Higher cost; budget may feel tight in prime streets.
priority_snapshot.commute_access: depends on address; check travel times
priority_snapshot.schools_family: generally family-friendly; parks/schools are a key advantage

top_districts.budget_reality: Rule of thumb for a €630,000–€1,130,000 purchase in this commune: target 2–3BR (sometimes 4BR) depending on condition/building type. Budget fit here is generally workable with more options; verify listing density and condition during viewings.

microhoods.name: Vivier D’oie
microhoods.highlights: Quiet residential area near the city edge with a more 'suburban' feel and easy access to green paths. Check access to daily shops without a car and confirm transit options for your exact address.

microhoods.name: Saint-Job Kauwberg
microhoods.highlights: Residential village-style pocket with access to green trails and a calmer pace; good for families prioritizing space. Street-by-street variation: check evening noise, parking permit rules, and commute time to your daily destinations.

inputs: Housing type: 2+ rooms; type: Not sure; mode: buy
matching: We only recommend communes and microhoods from the city pack (no invented areas).
Scores are computed from city-pack signals (amenities, transport, parks) + your budget.
Priority tags matched: families, nightlife, premium_feel.
